description.value:
You unleash the power of a supermassive black hole. All creatures in the area take 6d10 bludgeoning and 6d10 void damage. Event horizon ignores up to 10 resistance creatures in the area have to bludgeoning, and up to 10 resistance they have to void. Each creature attempts a Reflex save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Slowed]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Slowed]{Slowed 3} until the end of its next turn, and slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is slowed 3 until the end of its next turn, and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Slowed]{Slowed 2} for 1 minute.

You magically split an atom, creating an explosion with radioactive fallout. All targets in the area take 5d12 bludgeoning damage and 5d12 fire damage, and they're exposed to extreme radiation that uses your spellcasting DC as the @Check[fortitude]{Fortitude DC} for radiation sickness incurred by exposure to this radiation. The onset and frequency of this magical radiation is 1 round, and the area remains radioactive for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected by the initial damage.

Success The target takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Dazzled] for 1 minute.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Blinded] for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, and the target takes double damage.

You reach into the void and call down a vertical column of dangerous cosmic material that rains destruction upon creatures in the area and shrouds the terrain around it in a swirl of stardust. This matter is made up of bits of burning stars and chunks of frozen comets, and it deals 5d12 cold damage and 5d12 fire damage to every creature in the area when you Cast the Spell. For the spell's duration, the cosmic material reduces visibility and mobility, making the area greater difficult terrain and making everything seen within or through the area @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Concealed].

Heightened (10th) The cold and fire damage each increase by 2d12.

You flash freeze a target then send subsonic waves through it, potentially reducing it into fine powder. Make a spell attack against the target. If you hit a target, the target takes 6d8 cold damage and must attempt a Fortitude save. If you critically hit, the target gets a result one degree of success worse than it rolled on its Fortitude save. A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points is blasted to fine powder; its gear remains.

Critical Success The target is unaffected by further damage.

Success The target takes an additional 3d8 sonic damage.

Failure The target takes an additional 6d8 sonic damage.

Critical Failure The target takes an additional 12d8 sonic damage.

Heightened (+1) The cold and sonic damage each increase by 1d8.

You slice through reality, forming a chasm of life-draining entropy in a straight line 20 feet high, 120 feet long, and 2 inches thick. The chasm provides cover. The chasm deals 7d8 void damage to each creature that's in the chasm's space when it's created, that attempts to pass through the chasm, or that ends its turn inside the chasm, with a basic Reflex save. A creature that succeeds at this save when the chasm is created is pushed to the nearest space on the side of its choice. Creatures trying to move through the chasm fail to do so if they critically fail the save, ending their movement next to the chasm.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion, morph or polymorph effect in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

You take control of a technological creature or object and command it telepathically. If you issue an obviously self-destructive order to a sapient target, the target doesn't act until you issue a new order. The effect depends on its Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stunned]{Stunned 1} as it fights off your commands.

Failure You control the target. It gains the controlled condition, but it can attempt a Will save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the spell ends.

Critical Failure As a failure, but the target receives a new save only if it's sapient and you give it a new order that's against its nature, such as killing its allies.

Heightened (10th) The duration is unlimited.

duration.value: until the next time you make your daily preparations

target.value: 1 creature or hazard with the tech trait

description.value:
You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Escape] an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Immobilized], @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Grabbed], or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Restrained], they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher rank than the unfettered movement spell.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spell-effects.Item.Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement]

You supercharge the targets' electromagnetism and pull them with a tether of lightning. Make a ranged spell attack against each target. If you attack two targets, both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but it doesn't increase until after both attacks. The targets each take 4d8 electricity damage and are pulled 5 feet closer to you, or 10 feet closer on a critical hit. If both attacks hit, you can choose to move the creatures closer to one another instead of closer to you. Moving a target into a barrier, creature, or obstacle causes the target to stop before entering that space.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.

target.value: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item

description.value:
You focus on the target, gathering data as magical holograms display information. When the casting is complete, you learn biometric information about the target, including its fingerprints, medical conditions, and other basic physiological information. You or anyone you advise about the analysis gains a +1 status bonus to checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Impersonate] the creature, to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Treat Wounds] on the creature, and to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Recall Knowledge] about it. If the target is illusory or under the effects of illusion magic, you detect this only if the effect's rank is lower than the rank of your analyze target spell.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spell-effects.Item.Spell Effect: Analyze Target]

Heightened (3rd) The circumstance bonus increases to +2, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

Heightened (6th) The circumstance bonus increases to +3, and you can target any number of creatures.

You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.Invisibility Potion]) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

You reprogram a computer or device to display a chosen piece of data when accessed. You can implant up to one piece of data per spell rank. A piece of data can be a simple fact, such as a creature or object's location or physical description; an image of a creature or object; or a simple statement of no more than 300 characters. When the target computer or device is accessed, this implanted data is the first data the accessing creature gains, regardless of what data the creature is looking for. Implanted data doesn't prevent a creature from accessing other information stored on a device, change how the device functions, or otherwise inhibit the device from functioning. If this spell's duration ends before a creature accesses the implanted data, the information vanishes.

Heightened (3rd) The duration is one year.

Heightened (6th) The duration is unlimited.

You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical. You or anyone you advise about the aura gains a +2 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Identify Magic] on the item. If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's rank is lower than the rank of your read aura spell.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spell-effects.Item.Spell Effect: Read Aura]

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to 10 objects.

Heightened (6th) You can target any number of objects.

In your mind's eye, you chart a path through the cosmos. If you're in Pact Worlds space, you immediately know which direction to travel in order to reach the Starstone on Absalom Station. If you're outside the Pact System, you know the direction to the nearest Drift beacon or the Starstone.

Heightened (7th) You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a world or way station you've visited.

Granted by @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.Unfettered Movement]

You ignore circumstance penalties to your Speed.

The illumantula is a grouping of tiny tech bits that project energy between themselves, though the illumantula functions as single creature. The illumantula's size gives its space while being fully dispersed, though it can take actions to change its size. The illumantula can occupy the same space as other creatures and must do so to use some of its actions.

Trigger A creature moves within the illumantula's space or uses a manipulate action, move action, or ranged attack within 100 feet of the illumantula

Effect The illumantula attempts a ranged Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the illumantula disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the illumantula's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Creatures sharing a space with the illumantula can't use any actions or abilities with the fortune trait. A creature beginning its turn within the illumantula's space can't use actions or ability with the fortune trait until the end of their turn. The illumantula has weakness 10 against any ability or action affected by the fortune trait that successfully damages it.

The illumantula releases coordinated blasts from each of its constituent bits at creatures within its form. Each enemy in the illumantula's space takes @Damage[12d8[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:49|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Blinded] for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure). The blinding is a visual effect.

Frequency once per round

Effect The illumantula changes its size to either Huge, Large or Medium as desired. When changing size in this manner, the illumantula can determine what direction its new space takes up or what portion of its existing space is removed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

When the illumantula scores a critical hit with a transreality beam Strike, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Doomed]{Doomed 1}, or increases its doomed value by 1 if it was already doomed.

languages.details: First one, Can't speak, Telepathy 300 feet

details.publicNotes:
Though it only recently appeared in the shattered red deserts of the planet Akiton, the so-called illumantula has already become the stuff of local legend and folklore. Emerging shortly after the crash of the mysterious First Ones vessel now only known as the Wreck of the Returned, the illumantula was so named by the shobhad desert guides who first encountered the creature and compared it to the deadly spiders of the Akitonian glaciers. Other Pact Worlds citizens have taken to the name, as the closest descriptive title for the being has simply been "a spider made of light."

Contentfor nowto spend its days wandering the Wreck of the Returned and the immediately surrounding area, the illumantula has only had a handful of meaningful engagements since its appearance. The first was against a group of Hellknights of the Order of the Eclipse, where the illumantula systematically unmade 80 of their best-trained troops in under two minutes. Only weeks after the engagement, a group of Stewards attempting to enter the Wreck of the Returned were discovered and engaged at the periphery of the illumantula's patrol path. Only two of 12 commandos managed to escape, and their accounts of the illumantula and its powers are contradictory, leaving the Stewards unable to make effective plans for further encounters.

A strict quarantine has been set up to match the illumantula's patrol path, as calculated by the meticulous anacites of Investigation Site A01. The Aballonian constructs know the being to be related to the First Ones and dedicate their time to finding a means of communicating with the swarm of technological bits that patrol the outer wastes of the crashed starship. So far, they've had no success, and they've sent out an urgent call for linguistics and computers experts from across the Pact Worlds to travel to Akiton and aid their research.

Where the anacites continue their experiments, scholars of Eloritu have uncovered a disturbing connection between the illumantula and the concept of alternate realities. Somehow, the actions of the illumantula produce fixed points in reality, where the unique powers of creatures with greater connections to the multiverse are somehow stymied or forced to adhere to the illumantula's will. The reason for this phenomenon remains a mystery, though one the anacites seem blissfully ignorant to explore.

The appearance of the illumantula has led to the belief that it's a protector for the ancient technology of the mysterious First Ones. Similarities between the illumantula's technological bits and extracted data from Aballon have all but confirmed this theory. However, the association begs the question: is there just one illumantula, or is it merely one of many such highly advanced guardian constructs for the First Ones, a species who might be beyond anything the Pact Worlds could contend with?
